MKDADensity.summary: Multilevel kernel density analysis- Density analysis.

null_method.description: Method by which to determine uncorrected p-values. "approximate" is faster, but slightly less accurate. "montecarlo" can be much slower, and is only slightly more accurate.

n_iters.description: Number of iterations to use to define the null distribution. This is only used if ``null_method=="montecarlo"``. Default is 10000.

**kwargs.description: Keyword arguments. Arguments for the kernel_transformer can be assigned here, with the prefix '\kernel__' in the variable name.

null_method.description: Method by which to determine uncorrected p-values. "approximate" is faster, but slightly less accurate. "montecarlo" can be much slower, and is only slightly more accurate.

n_iters.description: Number of iterations to use to define the null distribution. This is only used if ``null_method=="montecarlo"``. Default is 10000.

**kwargs.description: Keyword arguments. Arguments for the kernel_transformer can be assigned here, with the prefix '\kernel__' in the variable name.

MKDAChi2.summary: Multilevel kernel density analysis- Chi-square analysis.

prior.description: Uniform prior probability of each feature being active in a map in the absence of evidence from the map. Default: 0.5

**kwargs.description: Keyword arguments. Arguments for the kernel_transformer can be assigned here, with the prefix '\kernel__' in the variable name.

null_method.description: Method by which to determine uncorrected p-values. "approximate" is faster, but slightly less accurate. "montecarlo" can be much slower, and is only slightly more accurate.

n_iters.description: Number of iterations to use to define the null distribution. This is only used if ``null_method=="montecarlo"``. Default is 10000.

**kwargs.description: Keyword arguments. Arguments for the kernel_transformer can be assigned here, with the prefix '\kernel__' in the variable name. Another optional argument is ``mask``.

kernel__fwhm.description: Full-width half-max for Gaussian kernel, if you want to have a constant kernel across Contrasts. Mutually exclusive with ``sample_size``.

kernel__sample_size.description: Sample size, used to derive FWHM for Gaussian kernel based on formulae from Eickhoff et al. (2012). This sample size overwrites the Contrast-specific sample sizes in the dataset, in order to hold kernel constant across Contrasts. Mutually exclusive with ``fwhm``.

**kwargs.description: Keyword arguments. Arguments for the kernel_transformer can be assigned here, with the prefix '\kernel__' in the variable name. Another optional argument is ``mask``.

kernel__fwhm.description: Full-width half-max for Gaussian kernel, if you want to have a constant kernel across Contrasts. Mutually exclusive with ``sample_size``.

kernel__sample_size.description: Sample size, used to derive FWHM for Gaussian kernel based on formulae from Eickhoff et al. (2012). This sample size overwrites the Contrast-specific sample sizes in the dataset, in order to hold kernel constant across Contrasts. Mutually exclusive with ``fwhm``.

n_iters.description: Number of iterations for correction. Default: 10000

xyz.description: Tab-delimited file of coordinates from database or numpy array with XYZ coordinates. Voxels are rows and x, y, z (meaning coordinates) values are the three columnns.

**kwargs.description: Keyword arguments. Arguments for the kernel_transformer can be assigned here, with the prefix '\kernel__' in the variable name.

kernel__fwhm.description: Full-width half-max for Gaussian kernel, if you want to have a constant kernel across Contrasts. Mutually exclusive with ``sample_size``.

kernel__sample_size.description: Sample size, used to derive FWHM for Gaussian kernel based on formulae from Eickhoff et al. (2012). This sample size overwrites the Contrast-specific sample sizes in the dataset, in order to hold kernel constant across Contrasts. Mutually exclusive with ``fwhm``.

FDRCorrector.summary: Perform false discovery rate correction on a meta-analysis.

alpha.description: The FDR correction rate to use.

method.description: The FDR correction to use. Either 'indep' (for independent or positively correlated values) or 'negcorr' (for general or negatively correlated tests).

FWECorrector.summary: Perform family-wise error rate correction on a meta-analysis.

method.description: The FWE correction to use. Available internal methods are 'bonferroni'. Additional methods may be implemented within the provided Estimator.

**kwargs.description: Keyword arguments to be used by the FWE correction implementation.
